Error.description: NextGenPSD2 specific definition of reporting error information in case of an HTTP error code.

text.description: Additional explaining text to the TPP.
text.example: The specified payment product is invalid

TppMessageGeneric.description: Informative message sent back to the TPP

combinedServiceIndicator.description: If "true" indicates that a payment initiation service will be addressed in the same "session"

frequencyPerDay.description: This field indicates the requested maximum frequency for an access without PSU involvement per day. Max: 4

recurringIndicator.description: "true", if the consent is for recurring access to the account data.  "false", if the consent is for one access to the account data

frequencyPerDay.description: How many requests per day you can call this service without needing strong customer authentication. Max: 5

lastActionDate.description: This date is containing the date of the last action on the consent object either through the XS2A interface or the PSU/ASPSP interface having an impact on the status.

recurringIndicator.description: decides if the consent is for recurring access to the account data

validUntil.description: This parameter is requesting a valid until date for the requested consent

amount.description: The amount given with fractional digits, where fractions must be compliant to the currency definition. Up to 14 significant figures. Negative amounts are signed by minus. The decimal separator is a dot.  **Example:** Valid representations for EUR with up to two decimals are:  * 1056  * 5768.2  * -1.50  * 5877.78

lastChangeDateTime.description: This data element might be used to indicate e.g. with the expected or booked balance that no action is known  on the account, which is not yet booked.

lastCommittedTransaction.description: "entryReference" of the last committed transaction to support the TPP in identifying whether all  PSU transactions are already known.

details.description: Specifications that might be provided by the ASPSP   - characteristics of the account   - characteristics of the relevant card

name.description: Name of the account given by the bank or the PSU in online-banking.

ownerName.description: Name of the legal account owner.

product.description: Product name of the bank for this account, proprietary definition.

resourceId.description: This is the data element to be used in the path when retrieving data from a dedicated account. This shall be filled, if addressable resource are created by the ASPSP on the /card-accounts endpoint.

usage.description: Specifies the usage of the account   * PRIV: private personal account   * ORGA: professional account

LinksAccountDetails.description: Links to the account, which can be directly used for retrieving account information from this dedicated account. Links to "balances" and/or "transactions" These links are only supported, when the corresponding consent has been already granted.

bban.description: Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN) Identifier  This data element can be used in the body of the Consent Request Message for retrieving Account access Consent from this Account. This data elements is used for payment Accounts which have no IBAN. ISO20022: Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN). Identifier used nationally by financial institutions, i.e., in individual countries, generally as part of a National Account Numbering Scheme(s), which uniquely identifies the account of a customer.

pan.description: Primary Account Number according to ISO/IEC 7812.

AccountReference.description: Reference to an account by either  * IBAN, of a payment accounts, or  * BBAN, for payment accounts if there is no IBAN, or  * the Primary Account Number (PAN) of a card, can be tokenised by the ASPSP due to PCI DSS requirements, or  * the Primary Account Number (PAN) of a card in a masked form, or  * an alias to access a payment account via a registered mobile phone number (MSISDN).

bban.description: Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN) Identifier  This data element can be used in the body of the Consent Request Message for retrieving Account access Consent from this Account. This data elements is used for payment Accounts which have no IBAN. ISO20022: Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN). Identifier used nationally by financial institutions, i.e., in individual countries, generally as part of a National Account Numbering Scheme(s), which uniquely identifies the account of a customer.

name.description: Name of the account given by the bank or the PSU in online-banking.

ownerName.description: Name of the legal account owner.

usage.description: Specifies the usage of the account   * PRIV: private personal account   * ORGA: professional account

AccountDetails.description: The ASPSP shall give at least one of the account reference identifiers:  - iban  - bban  - pan  - maskedPan  - msisdn If the account is a multi-currency account currency code in "currency" is set to "XXX".

href.description: Link to the next page of accounts

AccountReport.description: JSON based account report. This account report contains transactions resulting from the query parameters. 'booked' shall be contained if bookingStatus parameter is set to "booked" or "both". 'pending' is not contained if the bookingStatus parameter is set to "booked".

GetAccountTransactionsResponse.description: Body of the JSON response for a successful read transaction list request. This account report contains transactions resulting from the query parameters.

additionalInformation.description: Might be used by the ASPSP to transport additional transaction related information to the PSU.

bankTransactionCode.description: Bank transaction code as used by the ASPSP and using the sub elements of this structured code defined by ISO 20022.   This code type is concatenating the three ISO20022 Codes    * Domain Code,    * Family Code, and    * SubFamily Code  by hyphens, resulting in DomainCode-FamilyCode-SubFamilyCode.

bookingDate.description: The Date when an entry is posted to an account on the ASPSPs books.

creditorId.description: Identification of Creditors, e.g. a SEPA Creditor ID.

dnbTransactionDateTime.description: The timestamp when the transaction was initiated. Note that this is a DNB specific field.

dnbTransactionType.description: The transaction type. Note that this is a DNB specific field.

endToEndId.description: Unique end-to-end identity reference to be forwarded to the beneficiary.

entryReference.description: Is the identification of the transaction as used e.g. for reference for delta function on application level. The same identification as for example used within camt.05x messages.

mandateId.description: Identification of Mandates, e.g. a SEPA Mandate ID.

proprietaryBankTransactionCode.description: Proprietary bank transaction code as used within a community or within an ASPSP e.g. for MT94x based transaction reports.

remittanceInformationStructured.description: Reference as contained in the structured remittance reference structure (without the surrounding XML structure).  Different from other places the content is contained in plain form not in form of a structured field.

valueDate.description: The date at witch the transaction is interest-bearing

GetAccountBalancesResponse.description: Body of the response for a successful read balance for an account request.

parameters.name: psu-id
parameters.description: Client ID of the PSU in the ASPSP client interface. Might be mandated in the ASPSP's documentation. It might be contained even if an OAuth2 based authentication was performed in a pre-step or an OAuth2 based SCA was performed in an preceding AIS service in the same session. In this case the ASPSP might check whether PSU-ID and token match, according to ASPSP documentation.

parameters.name: tpp-redirect-uri
parameters.description: URI of the TPP, where the transaction flow shall be redirected to after a redirect.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: ID of the request, unique to the call, as determined by the initiating party.

parameters.name: psu-accept
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: psu-accept-charset
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: psu-accept-encoding
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: psu-accept-language
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: psu-device-id
parameters.description: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available. UUID identifies either a device or a device dependant application installation. In case of an installation identification this ID needs to be unaltered until removal from device.

parameters.name: psu-geo-location
parameters.description: The forwarded Geo Location of the corresponding http request between PSU and TPP if available.

parameters.name: psu-http-method
parameters.description: HTTP method used at the PSU ? TPP interface, if available. Valid values are: * GET * POST * PUT * PATCH * DELETE

parameters.name: psu-ip-address
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Address header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Address field between PSU and TPP. It must be contained if and only if this request was actively initiated by the PSU.

parameters.name: psu-ip-port
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Port header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Port field between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: psu-user-agent
parameters.description: The forwarded Agent header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: tpp-nok-redirect-uri
parameters.description: If this URI is contained, the TPP is asking to redirect the transaction flow to this address instead of the TPP-Redirect-URI in case of a negative result of the redirect SCA method. This might be ignored by the ASPSP.

parameters.name: tpp-explicit-authorisation-preferred
parameters.description: If it equals "true", the TPP prefers to start the authorisation process separately, e.g. because of the usage of a signing basket. This preference might be ignored by the ASPSP, if a signing basket is not supported as functionality. If it equals "false" or if the parameter is not used, there is no preference of the TPP. This especially indicates that the TPP assumes a direct authorisation of the transaction in the next step, without using a signing basket.

parameters.name: tpp-redirect-preferred
parameters.description: If it equals "true", the TPP prefers a redirect over an embedded SCA approach. If it equals "false", the TPP prefers not to be redirected for SCA. The ASPSP will then choose between the Embedded or the Decoupled SCA approach, depending on the choice of the SCA procedure by the TPP/PSU. If the parameter is not used, the ASPSP will choose the SCA approach to be applied depending on the SCA method chosen by the TPP/PSU.

parameters.name: tpp-use-async-consent-creation
parameters.description: Flag that indicates that the TPP wants to use async consent creation. When the flag is set to "true", the returned consent's consentStatus value is set to "received" and the create consent operation continues to run in the background on the server-side. The TPP is expected to fetch the consent status through either the "GET /consent/{consentId}/status" or the "GET /consent/{consentId}" endpoints to check if the consent resource is "valid" or not. Once the consent status becomes "valid", the TPP may use the consentId to continue with the account related services. The header is introduced to support creation of consent for users who have access to high number of accounts to avoid any timeout issues.

parameters.name: consentId
parameters.description: consentId

It might be contained even if an OAuth2 based authentication was performed in a pre-step or an OAuth2 based SCA was performed in an preceding AIS service in the same session. In this case the ASPSP might check whether PSU-ID and token match, according to ASPSP documentation.

parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: psu-device-id
parameters.description: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available. UUID identifies either a device or a device dependant application installation. In case of an installation identification this ID needs to be unaltered until removal from device.

parameters.name: psu-geo-location
parameters.description: The forwarded Geo Location of the corresponding http request between PSU and TPP if available.

parameters.name: psu-http-method
parameters.description: HTTP method used at the PSU ? TPP interface, if available. Valid values are: * GET * POST * PUT * PATCH * DELETE

parameters.name: psu-ip-address
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Address header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Address field between PSU and TPP. It must be contained if and only if this request was actively initiated by the PSU.

parameters.name: psu-ip-port
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Port header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Port field between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: psu-user-agent
parameters.description: The forwarded Agent header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: tpp-psu-initiated-request
parameters.description: This boolean header indicates if the request is initiatied by the PSU or through an offline / backend process by the TPP. Either this header should be set to true or the header PSU-IP-Address set with PSU IP for the request to be considered reaised by the PSU.

get.summary: Read transaction list of an account

parameters.name: accountResourceId
parameters.description: accountResourceId

parameters.name: bookingStatus
parameters.description: Booking status

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: ID of the request, unique to the call, as determined by the initiating party.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: From date, format: yyyy-MM-dd. If left blank, it will be set to 30 days before the beginning of the date range, which will be dateTo if specified, or the current date otherwise.

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: To date, format: yyyy-MM-dd. If left blank, it will be set to the current date.

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: Page ID
